God makes me who I am, not being accepted by certain people, and not having everything Iwant. I guess I just really realized for the first time what it means to be true to God and true to myself in my faith in him, and in that I've felt God in one of the most powerful ways ever, and I'm rambling, so I should probably stop now. So it's a Friday night, I'm at home, let's reminicse... Today was the last volleyball practice of my entire life. It was so weird, I can still remember walking into the gym my first day freshman year, and the thought " it won't be that bad" went through my mind. I've never been so wrong in my life. That day I almost died. It's just crazy to think about how much happened in those 4 years, and how fast they went by. I was also just thinking about how different each of my high school years was. Freshman year I hung out with so many kids that I don't even talk to anymore. It's weird to think that my best friends when I was a freshman are kids that I don't even so much as say hi to in the halls, it just shows how much people change in high school. Sophomore year was probably my best year, I looked up to those older kids so much, and just being around them helped me grow so much in my faith, and even if it sounds stupid they showed me what I wanted to be like when I was older. So Junior year when they were gone it was so hard for me at first, I didn't even know what to do. Junior year was probably my least favorite year, it brought with it a lot of crap, but I think it's also the year I grew the most. It's when I grew to become the least dependent on other people and most dependent on God and myself. I think everything I went through last year I learned from in some way or another so in the end I'm grateful for that. This year has been pretty good so far, but I think one of the things I've realized the most about myself is that I'm not the type of person who needs a lot of friends, or needs to be surrounded by people. Kinda the opposite, I like to be alone a lot, and would rather have like 3 or 4 good friends that I know I can trust and that I know are true friends than have a million people that I say are my friends but aren't really. I don't know...this is just me blabbing on and on. Anyways, tonight I was talking to my sister on the phone as I got to the football game and she heard me talking to people and what not and she told me I was making her miss Darien and then she said, "Meg, enjoy Darien as long as you're there" and it made me think about how even though I'm excited for college, this is my last year here and I don't think home will be the same once I leave here, so maybe I shouldn't be in such a rush to. So I think thats what I'm going to do....

I love my daddy... Today I was outside reading for school and the warm weather reminded me of when I was little and my daddy used to take us outside to play and he'd spray us with the hose. (Our version of a swimming pool). Even though my daddys old and people think he's crabby I think he's the best daddy in the world. When we would go to Cape Cod he would take us to the penny candy store, and I would get so excited to have a dollar to spend on candy. And then he'd take us to Four Seas Ice Cream, which has the best ice cream ever, and I would be so happy. Also on Cape Cod my sister and I became the "Flying Bolognia Sisters" and we would do simultaneous cart wheels and thought we were so cool. And my daddy would watch us and be proud of us. In Delaware he would take us to the drug store down the street called Happy Harrys and get us milky ways and peppermint patties (that went in the freezer). He loved giving us special treats like Klondike bars, or cheese balls, and when he made us chocolate milk he would put extra chocolate on the spoon for us to lick. And when I went to camp in the summer he would write me silly letters telling me he'd met Madonna or something crazy like that, then at the end he'd draw stick figures of my whole family and lable them. When I was really little I didn't like sleeping alone, and it took me a really long time to fall asleep. So my daddy would lie on my floor waiting for me to fall asleep, and sometimes he would try to sneak out but I would always catch him. I was also really scared of going upstairs alone in my old house, and so my daddy would always go with my and hold my hand and tell me there was nothing to be afraid of. For years he would tell my brother and me stories before we fell asleep, and they always started off with, "A long time ago a little girl and her brother..." They were the best stories ever. My daddy also sings random lines from old songs to me, and they've become engraned in my memory. The two that I remember the most are, "You're 16 you're beautiful and you're mine" and " I love you a bushel and a peck, bet your pretty neck I do." And before we go to bed at night my daddy always says, "Goodnight have happy dreams, dream about bunnies" I don't think I've ever once dreamt about bunnies, but thats ok. I love my daddy. "It is then that I can trust. In celebration of the air we breathe, we place all regrets aside. To capture this moment is to let go of the last. Love takes hold. How beautiful heaven must be..." -sleeping at last

I just realized that the biggest problem in my relationship with God is my unwillingness to feel uncomfortable, or do something I don't want to do. It's like I can create this faith that fits my needs so well, but completely ignores the desires of God for my life. I make a faith that conforms to the standards and expectations I have for my life. And then when I hit dry patches and wonder why I'm not growing, the thought creeps into my mind that maybe it's because I'm not truly living the life God is calling me to, but then I just push that thought aside and resolve that I need to spend more time in prayer or something. But thats not what it's about, faith in God and a relationship with Christ isn't about just having a daily quiet time and not swearing or whatever, it's about living your life knowing that he is all that matters, and sharing that with as many people as possible. So why do I waste my time doing anything else? Why do I try to make it into something else? Why is it so easy for me to love all these earthly things so much more then I love God? I feel change coming on in my heart, and I feel like now is the best possible time for it. I'm sick of saying that I want a life serving God and then watching opportunities pass me by. I want to be bold, I want to be real, I want to have faith that changes this world. I want to let go of this world...scripture says Christ has saved us from this world, so why do I hold onto it? What can it possibly offer me that God hasn't already conquered? I have to let go of myself and my plan for life, because deep down I know I will never be satisfied until I do that. I was reading this book a couple days ago and it talked about focusing on the cross, and absorbing how deep our need for it truly is. The author made the point of saying that when we sin it's stupid of us to say things like, "I can't believe I did that, I never thought I could do that" because we can...look at the cross, it's proof we can do the worst thing imaginable... kill the Son of God. But it's also proof that God loves us enough to use that act as something that opens the door between us and him. He said that we have to stop looking at ourselves as basically good, and instead as inately evil, and it's when that occurs that our need for a savior becomes so apparent, our ability to accept his forgiveness so much easier, and the scope of his love so incredible. I don't know if that's exactly what he said but thats what I got out of it. It made me realize I need to stop thinking I can do things that are good enough to get by in God's eyes, and instead humble myself to realizing that I am at his mercy, and without him there is nothing good about me. Clearly, I need work. And why I just decided to blog all of that I don't know, but maybe if anyone still reads this, they'll get something out of it, or maybe it's just senseless babbling that only makes sense to me.
